meanings.definition: The temporary prevention of something from continuing or being in effect.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the coach made two suspensions to teach the players a lesson.
meanings.sent2: The suspensions of the train service caused delays for the commuters.
meanings.sent3: The suspensions of dessert for misbehaving students led to protests in the cafeteria.
meanings.sent4: The suspensions of disbelief in the movie made the audience fully engrossed in the story.
meanings.sent5: The suspensions of the concert due to bad weather disappointed the fans.

meanings.definition: The action of suspending someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The suspensions of the troublemaker were necessary to maintain order in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The suspensions of the bridge construction worried the engineers.
meanings.sent3: The suspensions of the mischievous cat from climbing the curtains amused the family.
meanings.sent4: The suspensions of the clock's pendulum symbolized the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The suspensions of the criminal from the gang brought relief to the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: The state of being hung or supported from above.
meanings.sent1: The chandelier's suspensions added elegance to the ballroom.
meanings.sent2: The suspensions of the swing made it a fun spot in the playground.
meanings.sent3: The suspensions of the plant from the ceiling saved space in the small apartment.
meanings.sent4: The suspensions of the acrobat in mid-air captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The suspensions of the light fixture gave a modern look to the room.
